title: Guide to explosbuck
text: explosbuck package using explore Starbucks coffee chain data set, also provides calculation total difference number coffeehouses particular country countries. package 4 build-data sets named starbucks, tim_hortons, dunkin_donuts ISOcode, package mainly focused data set starbucks. data set come derived tidytuesday. vignette provides examples use functions package explosbuck perform: Calculation total number Starbucks coffeehouses country. Calculation difference number Starbucks coffeehouses two countries. Visualization total number Starbucks coffeehouses various countries.

title: Guide to explosbuck
text: count total number Starbucks coffeehouses Australia:
code: # Use ISOcode to find the code for Australia is AU # filter(ISOcode, Country == "Australia") count_sbuck(code = "AU") %>%   kable()

text: can install development version explosbuck GitHub :

title: Starbucks Coffeehouses Business and Geographical Data
Starbucks Coffeehouses Business and Geographical Data
text: access Starbucks data, first six rows: find two letter combination country code, first six rows: count total number Starbucks coffeehouses Australia: see difference total number Starbucks coffeehouses Australia United States: plot compare total number coffeehouses Australia, United States Canada:
code: library(knitr) head(starbucks) %>%   kable() head(ISOcode) %>%   kable() # Use ISOcode to find the code for Australia is AU # filter(ISOcode, Country == "Australia") count_sbuck(code = "AU") %>%   kable() diff_sbuck(code1 = "AU", code2 = "US") %>%   kable() plot_sbuck(code = c("AU", "US", "CA"))

title: ISO Country code — ISOcode
text: dataset containing names countries ISO country codes.

title: ISO Country code — ISOcode
text: data frame 65 rows 2 variables: Country_code two letter combination code representing country area Country Name country

what: Calculation of the total Starbucks coffeehouses — count_sbuck
title: Calculation of the total Starbucks coffeehouses — count_sbuck
text: function calculates total number Starbucks coffeehouses country, entering two-letter combination country code country.

title: Calculation of the total Starbucks coffeehouses — count_sbuck
Calculation of the total Starbucks coffeehouses — count_sbuck
text: code Character. two-letter combination country code

title: Calculation of the total Starbucks coffeehouses — count_sbuck
text: country Character : Two-letter country code. total Numeric : Total number coffeehouses.

title: Calculation of the total Starbucks coffeehouses — count_sbuck
code: # Define Australia's ISO country code: # filter(ISOcode, Country == "Australia")[1,1]  # Calculate the total number of Starbucks coffeehouses in Australia # code = "AU" count_sbuck(code = "AU") #> # A tibble: 1 × 2 #>   country total #>   <chr>   <int> #> 1 AU         22

what: Calculation of difference of coffeehouses between two countries — diff_sbuck
title: Calculation of difference of coffeehouses between two countries — diff_sbuck
text: function calculates difference total number Starbucks coffeehouses two countries, entering two-letter combination country codes countries.

title: Calculation of difference of coffeehouses between two countries — diff_sbuck
Calculation of difference of coffeehouses between two countries — diff_sbuck
text: code1 Character. two-letter combination code first country code2 Character. two-letter combination code second country

title: Calculation of difference of coffeehouses between two countries — diff_sbuck
text: Numeric. difference total number Starbucks coffeehouses two countries. difference difference value.

title: Calculation of difference of coffeehouses between two countries — diff_sbuck
code: # Define Countries ISO country code: # Define Australia's ISO country code: # filter(ISOcode, Country == "Australia")[1,1]  # Calculate the difference between Australia and China. # code1 = "AU" # code2 = "CN" diff_sbuck(code1 = "AU", code2 = "CN") #> [1] 2712

title: Plot of the total Starbucks coffeehouses (Shiny-parameterized function) — plot_sbuck
code: # Define Australia's ISO country code: # filter(ISOcode, Country == "Australia")[1,1]  # Plot the countries for a comparison # Australia code = "AU" # United State code = "US" # Canada code = "CA" # China code = "CN" plot_sbuck(c("AU", "US", "CA", "CN"))
